nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat
nodes.description: An enumeration that defines how a cell in a decision table is formulated by the rule creator.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration
nodes.description: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat
nodes.description: An enumeration that decides the rendering format for decisionTable.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType
nodes.description: An enumeration that defines the different business data types for an expression

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder
nodes.description: The sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control allows business users to create rules using a business language.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy
nodes.description: An enumeration that defines the output when more than one rule in the decision table is matched for a given set of inputs.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleType
nodes.description: An enumeration that defines whether the rule is formulated as a table with multiple rules instead of a rule with a single associated condition.

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration
nodes.description: The sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat
symbols.description: An enumeration that defines how a cell in a decision table is formulated by the rule creator.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat.Both
properties.description: Specifies that both rule formats are available in the decision table; allowing the rule creator to choose whether to formulate the decision table cells in either the basic or advanced format.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat.Guided
properties.description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell is restricted to values relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat.Text
properties.description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell receives all possible suggestions (relevant functions, attributes and values) that are relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

symbols.title: enum sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: undefined
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated. This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the property decisionTableFormat.

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration
symbols.description: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

properties.name: cellFormat
properties.description: The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated. This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.

properties.name: decisionTableFormat
properties.description: The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format

properties.name: enableSettings
properties.description: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

properties.name: hitPolicies
properties.description: The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load.

properties.name: visibleRowCount
properties.description: Number of visible rows of the table.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new DecisionTableConfiguration.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration itself.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: fireChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event change to attached listeners.

methods.name: getCellFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property cellFormat

methods.description:
Gets current value of property cellFormat.

The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.

Default value is Both.

deprecated.text: This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated. This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.

methods.name: getDecisionTableFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property decisionTableFormat

methods.description:
Gets current value of property decisionTableFormat.

The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format

Default value is CellFormat.

methods.name: getEnableSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableSettings.

The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

Default value is false.

methods.name: getHitPolicies

returnValue.description: Value of property hitPolicies

methods.description:
Gets current value of property hitPolicies.

The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs.

Default value is FirstMatch,AllMatch.

methods.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.

methods.name: getThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property threshold

methods.description:
Gets current value of property threshold.

The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load.

Default value is 30.

methods.name: getVisibleRowCount

returnValue.description: Value of property visibleRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property visibleRowCount.

Number of visible rows of the table.

Default value is 30.

methods.name: setCellFormat

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sCellFormat
parameters.description: New value for property cellFormat

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property cellFormat.

The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Both.

symbols.title: class sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat
symbols.description: An enumeration that decides the rendering format for decisionTable.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat.CellFormat
properties.description:
Specifies that the rendering of a cell is based on cellFormat and each cell can have a different format during rendering
Deprecated. This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.

deprecated.text: This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat.RuleFormat
properties.description: Specifies that the rendering is at the rule level. The value set here is applicable for all the cells in the rule.

symbols.title: enum sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType
symbols.description: An enumeration that defines the different business data types for an expression

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.All
properties.description: Specifies that the expression can be of any of the supported business data types.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.Boolean
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a Boolean data type: true, false.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.Date
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date only.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.Number
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a real number with or without dot-decimal notation.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.String
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a single-quoted UTF-8 encoded string.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.Time
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time only.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.TimeSpan
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time difference in milliseconds.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.Timestamp
properties.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date and timestamp.

symbols.title: enum sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder
symbols.description: The sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control allows business users to create rules using a business language.

properties.name: bindingContextPath
properties.description: Path to a Rule object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the RuleBuilder control (mandatory). Example: "/Rules(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5',Version='000001')"

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates whether or not the controls of the RuleBuilder are editable.

properties.name: types
properties.description: Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically.

aggregations.name: _ruleTypeSelector
aggregations.description: Provides a combo box from which the user selects the rule type for the new rule. Only relevant if types contains more than one value.

associations.name: astExpressionLanguage
associations.description: Expression language to use DMN SFEEL for modelling expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage is used.

associations.name: expressionLanguage
associations.description: Expression language to model English like expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage is used.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new RuleBuilder control.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.title: class sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy
symbols.description: An enumeration that defines the output when more than one rule in the decision table is matched for a given set of inputs.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy.AllMatch
properties.description: Specifies that all conditions that match the input (each matching row in the decision table) are returned as an output.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy.FirstMatch
properties.description: Specifies that only the first condition that matches the input (the first matching row by order in the decision table) is returned as an output.

symbols.title: enum sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleType
symbols.description: An enumeration that defines whether the rule is formulated as a table with multiple rules instead of a rule with a single associated condition.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleType.DecisionTable
properties.description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a table that allows complex rules to be visualized according to an if-then-else logic.

properties.name: sap.rules.ui.RuleType.TextRule
properties.description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a single condition, which is written directly in a business language.

symbols.title: enum sap.rules.ui.RuleType

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage
symbols.description: Provides the AstExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

properties.name: bindingContextPath
properties.description: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Ast Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the dataChange event of this sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage itself.

Detaches event handler fnFunction from the dataChange event of this sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.description: Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

properties.name: valueHelpCallback
properties.description: The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule.

Sets a new value for property valueHelpCallback.

The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.title: class sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage

symbols.name: sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration
symbols.description: The sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

properties.name: enableElse
properties.description: The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

properties.name: enableElseIf
properties.description: The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

properties.name: enableSettings
properties.description: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new TextRuleConfiguration.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration itself.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: fireChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event change to attached listeners.

methods.name: getEnableElse

returnValue.description: Value of property enableElse

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableElse.

The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableElseIf

returnValue.description: Value of property enableElseIf

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableElseIf.

The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableSettings.

The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

Default value is false.

The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.title: class sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage
nodes.description: Provides the AstExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

nodes.name: sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage
nodes.description: Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).
